title._content: Congregation Ansher Bialystok at 7 Willet Street between Grand and Broome Streets, New York

description._content: Title: Congregation Ansher Bialystok at 7 Willet Street between Grand and Broome Streets, New York Description: J.B. Lightman notes, “synagogue's architecture indicates converted church. Structure is of stone masonry, with iron fence surround. It is set back from the street, flanked by tenements on either side. Architecture appears old English with simple early Gothic windows. On right (not seen) 50 feet from street is a newly built addition 15 feet wide. Sign to left advertises Hanukah festival on December 17 featuring Cantor Joseph Mirsky. Another sign indicates drosches (lectures in Jewish studies) are delivered every Thursday.” Creator/Photographer: J. B. Lightman Medium: Photograph Date: November 26 1933 Persistent URL: digital.cjh.org/R/?func=dbin-jump-full&object_id=114616 Repository: American Jewish Historical Society Parent Collection: Graduate School for Jewish Social Work Lower East Side Photographic Collection Call Number: I-7 Roll XXXII-1 Rights Information: No known copyright restrictions; may be subject to third party rights. note._content: Although difficult to read, the sign advertises a Hanukah festival
note.author: 36988361@N08
